name: Playa Punta Roquitas
address: VXG4+RGV de la Costa Verde, Circuito de Playas, Miraflores 15074, Peru

reviews.author: Purba Dutta
reviews.text:
Playa Punta Roquitas is one of the most popular beaches in Lima, especially known for surfing. The waves are consistent and attract both beginners and experienced surfers, with surf schools and board rentals available right by the shore. The beach itself is rocky rather than sandy, so it‚Äôs not the best spot for sunbathing or swimming, but it makes up for it with its lively surf culture.

There‚Äôs a pedestrian path above the beach along the Malec√≥n, offering beautiful views of the Pacific Ocean, and it‚Äôs a great place to watch the surfers. Sunset views are spectacular. Parking can be tricky during busy times, and the beach doesn‚Äôt have many facilities beyond surf-related services, so plan accordingly.

Overall, Playa Punta Roquitas is perfect if you‚Äôre into surfing or just want to enjoy the ocean atmosphere in Miraflores. For a relaxing beach day, you might prefer another spot, but for surf and energy, this place is hard to beat.

reviews.author: Phillip Brooks
reviews.text:
This is a great place for watching or trying out surfing or just to watch the waves crashing down.

It's just down from the Cliff parks, there are a few places with steps down.

There is an area with lots of Surf schools of you want a lesson.

My girlfriend and I were on a run along the cliff parks, the Love park then the Chinese park then down the steps and along the sea front üåä.

It was great to see the waves crashing down, the sound of the stones rolling and the small of the Pacific.

reviews.author: Paul Trudell
reviews.text: Great place to watch the surfers or try a hand at it yourself.  There are local shops set up to rent equipment and pay for surfing sessions.  Beachs are rocky and not easy to swim in.

reviews.author: Andres Vargas Higuera
reviews.text: It's a beautiful rocky beach, popular with surfers. Early morning is the perfect time for a refreshing swim or simply relaxing and watching the waves

reviews.author: T Mc
reviews.text:
A very scenic view, and a nice place to stroll, sit by the beach , have a quick swim or surf.
To get to the sea by walking, there is access down a gentle meandering path on the side of a cliff that joins a walking over bridge above the motoway.
There is also a small carpark if you drive there.

reviews.author: M J
reviews.text: Fantastic beach on Pacific coast, a heaven for beachgoers. This beach is specially loved by vave surfers. I give it to the authorities to keep the beach clean and tidy. Also security around the beach and surrounding areas is well kept. üëçüòé

reviews.author: Dale Plotzki
reviews.text:
#LocalGuidesSurf
2 stars for the wave, not the beach or park. I hate this wave. It is a boucning, small backwash runner. People take it as a left for small distances but it always closes out. There is very little paddling to get to this spot which is why I think people surf here. It jacks up very quickly, then gets hit by the backwash coming off the beach and flattens out to nothing; the wave washes right out from under your feet. Finally, the way the Eddy from the current works, this is rumoured to be the dirtiest wave on the Costa Verde, which is a bummer.

reviews.author: David Berm
reviews.text: Went here for a surfing class and got absolutely destroyed. Great waves, but go only if you know what you are doing.

reviews.author: Lula
reviews.text: Many surfers in this area . The sunset is amazing

reviews.author: Boris La Noire
reviews.text: Very  clean and safe place  to go ,there is no sand, but the water  was awesome

name: Playita Costa Verde
address: Playita Costa Verde, Cto. de Playas de la Costa Verde, Miraflores 15074, Peru

reviews.author: Purba Dutta
reviews.text:
Playita Costa Verde is one of the more family-friendly beaches along Lima‚Äôs Costa Verde. Unlike the rockier stretches nearby, this small beach has a gentler setting and is popular with locals who come to relax, swim, or enjoy a picnic by the water. The atmosphere is calmer compared to the big surf beaches, making it a good spot if you‚Äôre looking for a casual beach day in the city.

It‚Äôs easily accessible from the coastal highway, with some basic facilities around, though parking can get tight on busy weekends. The ocean view is beautiful, and it‚Äôs a nice place to spend a couple of hours away from the hustle of Miraflores. While it may not have the fine white sand of tropical beaches, its convenience and laid-back vibe make it a worthwhile stop.

reviews.author: Nicolai Bustinza
reviews.text: I went to Costa Verde Beach at night and loved the atmosphere. It's a peaceful place to walk, enjoy the sound of the ocean, and see the city lights reflected in the water. The area is safe and clean, and I like to come here to relax after a long day. It's a bit far from Callao, but it's always worth spending some time by the ocean and unwinding a bit.

reviews.author: jhonatan riza
reviews.text:
I found space to park my motorcycle.
Nice beach. They don't allow alcohol, but I think it's better this way. You can watch the sunset and throw rocks into the sea.

reviews.author: Juliana Juli
reviews.text:
It is a beach with quite a few stones, you can get to this beach from the boardwalk, specifically from the Mar√≠a Reiche park where it has a descent with many stairs.
I find it difficult to enter to bathe on this beach. However, some surfers enter to practice their sport.
On the other hand, this beach is more secluded than Punta Roquitas beach, which you can also go down from the boardwalk.

name: Playa Los Delfines
address: Playa Los Delfines, Circuito de Playas, Miraflores 15074, Peru

reviews.author: Purba Dutta
reviews.text:
Playa Los Delfines is a quieter, rocky beach in Miraflores, popular with locals who enjoy jogging or walking along the Malec√≥n rather than swimming. The beach itself isn‚Äôt sandy, so it‚Äôs not ideal for sunbathing, but it offers peaceful ocean views and a more relaxed atmosphere compared to the busier surf spots nearby.

It‚Äôs also known for the large dolphin statue that gives the beach its name, making it a nice photo stop. The surrounding cliffs and coastal paths provide beautiful views, especially at sunset. There aren‚Äôt many facilities directly on the beach, so it‚Äôs best to visit for the scenery, a walk, or some quiet time by the water.

reviews.author: Rytis S
reviews.text: Pebble beach with long Pacific waves. Accessible through a pedestrian bridge across the highway. Nice ocean feeling. Do recommend checking.

reviews.author: Constantin Cosminsky
reviews.text: Nice waves

reviews.author: Samuel B.
reviews.text: It's rocky and the water is relatively cold. There are no restaurants or food nearby for a snack or a meal. I only recommend it for a visit, to appreciate the view, and to sunbathe. It's very safe and peaceful, though.

reviews.author: monica nieves
reviews.text: A very nice place.

reviews.author: Joy Piao
reviews.text: That sound from the ocean on the pebble beach is so unique and soothing!

reviews.author: Kane Anderson
reviews.text: Surfing galore. Plenty of available lessons and locals in this rocky but friendly beach.

reviews.author: Alice Zymelka
reviews.text:
Nice beach with parking lot and public toilets available.
It's a little tricky to reach the entrance of the parking when coming by car, so be sure to drive careful.
The view from there is really beautiful

reviews.author: Guilherme Lino
reviews.text: Great cannabis

reviews.author: Adrian Ortiz
reviews.text: The beach has a somewhat sad appearance, even though it's wide, with medium-small stones and moderate waves. It has parking, a lifeguard stand, a kiosk, soccer fields, and is good for walking. It's wide, but there aren't many people camping on the rocks. It's below Larcomar.

reviews.author: Amy Kingan
reviews.text: Cool place. Bit of a walk down, but worth the trek. Lots happening.

reviews.author: Ole Leon
reviews.text:
Enjoying a sunset with the sound of the waves hitting the pebbles on the shore is the charm of this beach, because there are any number of pebbles. We enjoyed a beautiful Lima sunset and saw several pelicans and seagulls feeding here.
There's parking and easy access. I wouldn't recommend swimming here, due to the number of pebbles, but I would recommend it for enjoying a beautiful sunset.

reviews.author: Jean Chaparro
reviews.text: Very nice, this place is very quiet, it gives you a prosperity and a tranquility that is priceless. Surely right now that it is winter the beaches are very cold, but come in anyway, my friend, the beach relaxes you, it gives you good vibes and releases all those impurities. I really liked being in Lima, but remember I went in the summer, the beach was still a bit cold because I went at night, and well, it is easy to get to, there are not many people, it is pleasant.

reviews.author: Luccas Camargos
reviews.text: √ìtima para passar a tarde

reviews.author: Israel Atoche
reviews.text: The place is perfect to go and de-stress from the city, it is next to the road, it has parking that is usually full in summer, the caretaker actually asks you for a tip since it is public

reviews.author: Purba Dutta
reviews.text:
Playa Waikiki is a well-known surf spot in Miraflores, located right below the Parque del Amor. It‚Äôs a favorite among beginner surfers thanks to its smaller, more manageable waves and the number of surf schools offering lessons and rentals right on the beach. The name gives it a fun, laid-back vibe, and the surf community here is welcoming.

Like most of Lima‚Äôs beaches, it‚Äôs rocky rather than sandy, so it‚Äôs not ideal for lounging or swimming. Instead, the charm is in its surf culture and its accessibility‚Äîit‚Äôs one of the easiest beaches to reach from central Miraflores. The Malec√≥n above gives beautiful views of the action below, and sunsets here are especially nice.

Playa Waikiki is best if you want to learn to surf, rent a board for a few hours, or simply watch the lively scene by the water.

reviews.author: Jamaiquino
reviews.text: First time seeing a stone beach. Water is nice. I think this water is for experience swimmers because the rocks can be slippery.

reviews.author: Piotr Michalski
reviews.text: A fantastic pebble beach (similar to the beaches of Batumi for example) with top-notch views of Lima's cliffs. Rich in wildlife. Great for the first contact with Lima and the Pacific Ocean. Once there you can't miss the peculiar sound when the waves backtrack.

reviews.author: Zachary Barnwell
reviews.text: Very busy beach over the weekend. Lots of smooth rocks the size of a fist instead of sand.  Recommend water shoes. Waves are medium to large. Good waves for surfers since they break way out before the shore.

reviews.author: L.K. Reyes
reviews.text: Very nice relaxing beach!

reviews.author: Purba Dutta
reviews.text:
Playa La Estrella is one of the calmer beaches along the Costa Verde, located near the Bajada Balta in Miraflores. It has a quieter atmosphere compared to the busier surf beaches like Makaha or Redondo, making it a pleasant spot for a peaceful walk or to sit by the water. The rocky shore and moderate waves mean it‚Äôs not the best for swimming or lounging, but it‚Äôs perfect if you want to enjoy ocean views without heavy crowds.

The beach takes its name from the nearby Parque La Estrella above the cliffs, which offers a great view of the coastline. It‚Äôs also a nice place to catch the sunset or simply enjoy the sound of the waves.

Playa La Estrella is best for those seeking a low-key, scenic beach stop in Miraflores rather than an active surf scene.

reviews.author: Tony Mora
reviews.text: Yes, it is a beautiful beach,  clear water & clean sand. The water is a little to cold for me, maybe in the summer time time is best for swimming. The view of the beach through the horizon is breathtaking, blue üíô waters üíßand calm waves. The the local beach goers seems to have a great time. So far the view of beach is incredible, I want to jump to the beach waters but I better not, I better  play it in the save way. I had a great experience here, we will come back.  Thank you  to our body guard for taking us to this location, it is so beautiful,  we love üíò it.  Sincerely,  TONY MORA üôè.

reviews.author: Brian Baber
reviews.text: Loud music playing from cars at all hours of the night to as early as 5:30 am. Where is the security?

reviews.author: Erin McClarty
reviews.text: Beautiful

reviews.author: Adrian Ortiz
reviews.text: A medium-sized pebble beach with a steep drop-off along almost its entire short length. The waves are medium-sized, breaking almost on the shore, making swimming difficult. It's somewhat deserted, and its seawall needs work. The waters are somewhat greenish. There is a lifeguard station just below the Armendariz descent.

reviews.author: Purba Dutta
reviews.text:
Playa Redondo I is a popular beach along the Costa Verde, especially loved by surfers for its strong and consistent waves. The conditions are better suited for intermediate and advanced surfers, as the waves can be powerful and challenging. Surf schools and rentals are available, but most of the action here is from more experienced riders.

Like most of Lima‚Äôs beaches, Redondo I is rocky, so it‚Äôs not designed for lounging or swimming. Instead, it‚Äôs all about surf culture and ocean views. The Malec√≥n above the cliffs provides excellent lookout points where you can watch surfers riding the waves, and the sunsets are spectacular.

If you‚Äôre a confident surfer or just want to enjoy Lima‚Äôs surf scene at its most energetic, Playa Redondo I is a great spot to visit.

reviews.author: Tasnia Hasan
reviews.text: Very beautiful, and peaceful place where you can sit and lose track of time! The beach is well maintained, it's very clean. If you are visiting Lima, visiting this beach is highly recommended.

reviews.author: Estefania Pu√±o
reviews.text: The beach has sand and stones. If you want to go in the sea, you have to wear aquashoes, or there's a man who brings you seawater in a large bucket and charges you S/. It also has medical stations and several security guards.

reviews.author: Adrian Ortiz
reviews.text: The beach is improving its appearance. They've added sand and thatched umbrellas in one area. It's wide, with medium-sized pebbles and moderate waves. It has parking, a lifeguard station, a kiosk, soccer fields, and is good for walking. It's more crowded than its sister beach, Ronda, due to the sandy area. It's located below Larcomar.

reviews.author: Walter Fernandez
reviews.text: It has a security post and you can leave your vehicle safely.

reviews.author: Purba Dutta
reviews.text:
Playa La Pampilla is one of the top surfing beaches in Lima, especially for beginners and intermediate surfers. The waves are more manageable compared to Punta Roquitas, and there are plenty of surf schools and board rentals available right at the shore. The surf community here is friendly, and you‚Äôll often see people taking lessons or practicing in groups.

The beach itself is rocky, not sandy, so it‚Äôs not the best for lounging or swimming. Still, the energy from the surfers and the beautiful views of the Pacific make it worth a visit. It‚Äôs located conveniently below Miraflores, and the Malec√≥n above offers excellent vantage points to watch the surfers or enjoy a sunset walk.

Overall, Playa La Pampilla is ideal if you want to try surfing in Lima or simply soak in the vibrant surf culture.

reviews.author: Dale Plotzki
reviews.text:
#LocalGuidesSurf
Arguably the Costa Verdes best ride, and one of those rare rights in Peru. From the peak, you can ride a perfect head-high wave to the beach. A good 25 second ride. But the spot is very picky; too much tide and the wave flattens out; too much size and the current pulls you out of position. Works best all the way up to 2m on a low to mid tide.

reviews.author: Ole Leon
reviews.text: When we arrived, the sun wasn't very bright and it was cloudy, chilly, and breezy. Then the sun began to come out, and the area became more enjoyable. Many parts of the entire coastal path aren't maintained and are somewhat neglected‚Äîthe benches, the lanterns, even the bicycle and pedestrian bridge. Keeping these details in mind, it's still beautiful to walk near the beach.

reviews.author: Diana Lewis
reviews.text: Beach with small stones, you can rest peacefully, few people. Waves a little strong, wear shoes because it is a little painful to walk on the pebbles

reviews.author: Adrian Ortiz
reviews.text: A beach with small stones in the north and large ones in the south. You can even lay out your towel or swim in the pool. It has medium to large waves with strong retreat. There are lifeguards, and swimming is a bit rough. There are surfers in the background. Cars park along the waterfront.

reviews.author: Purba Dutta
reviews.text:
Playa Makaha is one of the most iconic surfing beaches in Lima and a must-visit for anyone wanting to catch waves along the Costa Verde. Known for its consistent surf, it attracts both beginners and seasoned surfers. Several surf schools and board rental shops operate right at the beach, making it one of the easiest spots to learn or practice.

The beach is rocky, like most in Lima, so it‚Äôs not ideal for sunbathing, but the lively surf culture more than makes up for it. The view of the cliffs and the Malec√≥n above adds to the atmosphere, and it‚Äôs also a great place to simply watch surfers in action if you‚Äôre not hitting the water yourself.

Overall, Playa Makaha is best for surfing and soaking up Lima‚Äôs coastal energy‚Äîone of the top choices for water sports in Miraflores.

reviews.author: Young Cho
reviews.text: I took a surf lesson for the fist time. They provided me a wetsuit, shoes and a surf board. It was twenty minutes of basic skills on site and then one hour in water. The temperature was 18'C and the water was a little bit cold. It was definitely fun.

reviews.author: Eran Rubman
reviews.text: Nice surfing beach, but there are sea urchins. Make sure you wear water shoes and try not to step on the rocks.

reviews.author: Sam
reviews.text: Great for beginner surfers. The beach is all rocks, not sand, so wear sandals. The locals are nice, ans surf lessons are reasonably priced. My girlfriend amd I went surfing for the first time and we both got up on the surfboard. She didn't even know how to swim. There's ussually a few locals with GoPros who will sell you pictures and videos of you surfing. Great experience!

reviews.author: G. A.
reviews.text: Playa Makaha or Macaca hmmm. Nice from afar but once up close the beach smells weird and the muscles are spoiling on the rocks and flys everywhere. If you don't mind this then it's ok.

reviews.author: Pedro Trebbi
reviews.text: Lugar calmo, seguro e incr√≠vel para ver o por do sol.

reviews.author: Franklin C J
reviews.text: Redondo Beach in Miraflores is a popular spot for surfers and vacationers. In the summer, the heat and sun are intense, so bring sunscreen. I tried a delicious raspadilla (or shaved ice) with delicious flavors at a good price (there was a special offer for two). A great place to visit any day of the week.

reviews.author: MasterKillua
reviews.text: It's a very pretty place. It has a good view.

reviews.author: Lays√≠n Cok C√©spedes
reviews.text: Spacious and clean. Recommended for children.

reviews.author: Julio Cesar Rosillo Alvarez
reviews.text: Incredible

reviews.author: Boris
reviews.text: Can't go to Lima and Miraflores if you are going to miss this.Absolutely magnificent!

reviews.author: balooko31
reviews.text: Amazingly beautiful views üòç and you can walk to anything you need, whether you're looking for a quick bite, fine dining, groceries, dessert, entertainment, etc

reviews.author: M- T-
reviews.text: Beautiful views and walk. Definitely a great stop when in town and get a feel of the city

reviews.author: Retta
reviews.text: I love this area. There is so much to do! So much and you could really spend all day here just sitting, people watching and more. I have also ran here too! If you are looking for a free activity please visit here.

reviews.author: Kary Lin
reviews.text: Nice view

reviews.author: Christian del pozo
reviews.text: Beautiful view for sunset and for walking along the beach üèñÔ∏è.

reviews.author: Carmela Sutta
reviews.text: They are very cute

reviews.author: Sofian
reviews.text: Be careful of sea urchins, wear sandals to avoid getting stung.

reviews.author: yuyulines tv
reviews.text: The best beach on the entire Costa Verde, it has waves less than a meter high and is quite calm.

reviews.author: Yesselyn Marne Chamorro Claro (Yessel)
reviews.text: Be very careful, they robbed us, they broke the car window and took everything... A very ugly experience actually üòî.

name: Bajada de Armend√°riz (circuito de playas) Miraflores
address: VX6C+8VJ, Bajada de Armendariz, Miraflores 15074, Peru

reviews.author: Antonio Melgarejo Yaranga
reviews.text: Horrible. Terribly polluted lighting. Dangerous bridge.

reviews.author: Diego Toulier 18
reviews.text: One of the best views of the Pacific Ocean from Lima, before that bridge existed.

reviews.author: Marcela Crispin
reviews.text: Spectacular landscape and beach two in one.

reviews.author: Alberto Soto
reviews.text: Excellent, without words.

reviews.author: Mateo Paredes
reviews.text: It's a great quick route to get down to the beach. Not too crowded.

reviews.author: Ash Ster
reviews.text:
Playa Makaha is a beautiful beach located in the Miraflores district of Lima, Peru. It's known for its scenic coastline and is a popular destination for beachgoers and surfers. The beach offers a relaxed atmosphere, making it a great place to enjoy the sun, sand, and surf.

Beach is filled with boulders, so not good to wade in shallow waters. Surfing though is fun. Rent gear, surf board and instructor for cheap!

reviews.author: Keyla Pe√±a
reviews.text: There is no pedestrian access. They should add showers to remove the salt, changing rooms, and public restrooms. The beach is rocky; take precautions; sun exposure is direct, as there are no parasol rentals. If you are traveling with children, it is advisable to bring your own vehicle or pay for a taxi, as the road to Larco Avenue is steep and has many stairs.

reviews.author: Edu Durand P
reviews.text:
You can go downstairs for snacks or a drink; it's super quiet.
There are public restrooms.

reviews.author: michele luigi crescentini
reviews.text: Surf beach, there are various surf schools and some restaurants or food shops

reviews.author: omar vera rodas
reviews.text: I loved this place because it is beautiful and where you can practice surfing and there are good teachers who teach you if you are one of those people who like extreme sports I recommend it.

name: Puente Peatonal Playa Redondo I
address: VX89+HWF, Circuito de Playas, Miraflores 15074, Peru
